Overall, I had a very enjoyable experience and would highly recommend checking out this truck if you're ever in Tokyo.

A delightful King Combo experience at Cheeky Greek in Mumbai. The gyro boasted tender lamb, perfectly seasoned, with fresh toppings and a crispy pita. Honestly, I'm quite disappointed with the "Cheeky Greek" gyro plate I ordered. The meat was tough and flavorless, and the salad was far from fresh. Smoky BBQ truck's Two Meat Plate in Delhi underdelivered. Meat was overcooked, dry, and missing the promised smoky flavor. Sides were unremarkable and lacked inspiration. Portion size was small considering the cost. Disappointing meal that fell short of expectations.

Overall, I highly recommend The Mega Melt for anyone seeking a mouthwatering grilled cheese sandwich.

The Freezing Point truck's ice cream is a delight, and their service is impeccable. Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the expected punch, tasting more like bland vegetable soup than a rich, spicy ramen. Disappointing Experience.The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. The Lean Chicken Tibs, which should have been the star of the meal, was dry and overcooked. The Veggie Combo was bland and uninspiring, not at all what I expected from an Ethiopian menu. The Bottled Soda was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, Tasty Tibs in Melbourne failed to deliver the authentic and flavorful Ethiopian cuisine I was hoping for.

The "Better Off Bread" sandwich shop in Cape Town recently fulfilled an order consisting of two Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches, two Italian sandwiches, two bottled sodas, and two Pastrami sandwiches. This order falls under the "Sandwiches" menu type and is substantial, with a good variety of items. Unfortunately, the review cannot delve into specifics about the individual items or the quality of the ingredients used in the sandwiches, as this information is not provided.

A breakfast crepe and crepe Suzette ordered at Le Coin des Crêpes in Cape Town were disappointing. The crepes lacked the promised "soft, fluffy" texture, instead they were dry and overcooked. Furthermore, the ice tea served was tepid and failed to deliver the refreshing experience advertised. Unfortunately, the food and drink did not meet the high expectations set and did not justify their price.

The menu at Nani's Kitchen, a vibrant Indian restaurant in Berlin, offers a tantalizing array of flavorful dishes. The ice tea, a refreshing accompaniment, perfectly complemented the aromatic curry. The combination curry, a generous portion of tender chicken in a creamy sauce, was a testament to the restaurant's culinary prowess. The tandoori mixed grill, featuring succulent skewers of chicken and vegetables marinated in traditional tandoori spices, showcased the restaurant's ability to infuse bold flavors. The lean chicken tikka masala, a healthier twist on the classic, was equally satisfying, with tender chicken marinated in a flavorful yogurt-based sauce. Overall, the food at Nani's Kitchen is a testament to the vibrant and flavorful Indian cuisine that Berlin has to offer.

Nani's Kitchen's Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was an explosion of flavorful delight. The tender chicken soaked in the creamy tikka masala, infused with aromatic spices, melted in my mouth. The generous portions were perfect for sharing, and the naan, soft as a cloud, complemented the dish expertly. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the service was attentive. Overall, I couldn't fault the deliciousness and hospitality of Nani's Kitchen.

Mega Melt truck in Delhi, a haven for grilled cheese enthusiasts! A recent visit allowed me to sample The Ranch and Miss Piggie, both of which were utterly delectable. The Ranch presented an ideal fusion of cheesy richness with a subtle ranch tang, while Miss Piggie offered a savory treat with its distinctive blend of cheese and bacon. The bread, toasted to perfection, added a pleasing crunch to each bite. Swift and amiable service further enhanced the dining experience. For a scrumptious and fulfilling meal, Mega Melt comes highly recommended.

A calamitous experience with the King Combo and Gyro Plate at Cheeky Greek in Seattle. Meat disappointingly dry and devoid of flavor, pita limp and overly greasy, tzatziki sauce cloyingly sweet and runny. The lone consolation: an ample serving size. Advisable against suggesting this restaurant to others.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack. The Standard Mac & Cheese, far from being a culinary delight, was a bland and uninspired dish. The cheese sauce lacked the expected creaminess, and the pasta was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The presentation was as lackluster as the taste. Considering the hype around this truck in Barcelona, the experience was a letdown. I expected more from a place that specializes in Mac & Cheese. Unfortunately, The Mac Shack failed to deliver on both taste and quality.

Oh dear, I recently tried the "Tasty Tibs" Ethiopian food truck in Sydney and I must say, I was quite disappointed. I ordered the Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs, expecting tender and flavorful meat. However, both were overcooked and lacked seasoning. The texture was tough and chewy, and the taste was bland. Additionally, I was served a bottled soda instead of the traditional Ethiopian beverage I was hoping for. The entire experience was underwhelming and did not live up to the hype of Ethiopian cuisine. I would not recommend this food truck to anyone looking for authentic and delicious Ethiopian food.

**** The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs menu offers a tantalizing selection of hot dogs, bottled water, and ice tea. The New York Dog and Coney Dog were succulent, with their signature toppings and condiments. The bottled water and ice tea provided a refreshing accompaniment to the hot dogs. The atmosphere in Hamburg was inviting, and the service was prompt. Overall, a satisfactory dining experience.

"Tasty Tibs truly lives up to its name! The Lean Beef Tibs I ordered was an absolute delight. The meat was tender, perfectly seasoned, and cooked to perfection. The Ethiopian spices added a unique and flavorful twist, making it a standout dish. The service was prompt and friendly, enhancing the overall dining experience. If you're in Munich and craving Ethiopian cuisine, Tasty Tibs is a must-visit. I'm already looking forward to my next meal here!"

Tantalizing selection of hot dogs in the heart of Barcelona, "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck offers a variety of options that are sure to satisfy any hot dog craving. The menu features classic styles such as New York, Chicago, and Coney Island, each with its own unique twist.The New York Dog is loaded with sauerkraut, onions, and tomatoes, while the Chicago Dog boasts a poppy seed bun, relish, and a generous helping of fresh cheese. For those looking for something a little different, the Coney Dog is a standout, topped with a sweet and tangy relish, chopped onions, and a sprinkle of chili powder.The hot dogs are not only delicious but also affordably priced, making "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" a great option for a quick and tasty meal in Barcelona. Whether you're a hot dog enthusiast or just looking for a convenient bite to eat, this truck is sure to impress.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The crepes from Le Coin des Crêpes were a massive disappointment. The Breakfast Crepe was bland and uninspiring, while the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was overly salty, with a filling that tasted more like canned soup than a freshly prepared meal. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was drowning in a syrup that was too sweet, completely overpowering the delicate flavor of the crepe itself. The drinks, Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea, were the only saving grace, but they alone couldn't make up for the lackluster food. Not the experience I was hoping for in Barcelona.

Disappointed with Freezing Point's Popsicle in Stockholm. The ice cream failed to deliver the promised taste and texture. Instead of a refreshing treat, it was icy and lackluster. The flavor was barely there, making it a forgettable experience. I expected more from a place known for its ice cream. Not worth the visit.

The "Le Coin des Crêpes" order summary represents a poor experience. The item ordered included an ice tea, a crepe Suzette, and a chicken pot pie crepe. However, the establishment failed to provide adequate service and the food quality was unacceptable. The crepe Suzette was overly dry and lacked sufficient fillings, while the chicken pot pie crepe was cold and unappetizing. The ice tea was also subpar, lacking sufficient cooling power. Overall, the meal was far from satisfactory and did not meet expectations.

"Tasty Tibs truly lives up to its name! The Lean Chicken Tibs was a gastronomic delight, perfectly blending Ethiopian spices with tender, succulent chicken. The dish was not only a treat for the taste buds but also a testament to the rich culinary tradition it represents. The service was prompt and the staff, courteous. If you're in Delhi and craving Ethiopian cuisine, Tasty Tibs is your go-to place. A must-try for food enthusiasts!"

The Better Off Bread truck, located in Warsaw, is a popular spot for delicious sandwiches. I recently ordered a Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese, and Italian sandwich, as well as some iced tea and bottled water. The Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich was a classic choice, with plenty of meat, cheese, and bread. The Italian sandwich was a bit more unique, with roasted vegetables, salami, and pesto. All of the food was fresh and flavorful, and the service was friendly. Overall, I would highly recommend checking out Better Off Bread if you're looking for a quick and satisfying meal.

Peking Truck's menu showcases their mastery of Chinese cuisine. The combo fried rice features perfectly cooked grains with a well-balanced mix of vegetables and meat. Wonton soup boasts tender wontons and a rich broth, while the combo lo mein offers fresh noodles and a bountiful assortment of vegetables and meat. Authentic and satisfying, Peking Truck's food delivers a noteworthy culinary experience in Berlin's core.

A true gem for mac and cheese lovers, The Mac Shack in New York City offers a delightful variety of this classic comfort food on their menu. The Standard Mac & Cheese was creamy and perfectly cheesy, a true testament to their mastery of the dish. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese added a delightful kick, while the Lobster Mac & Cheese brought a touch of luxury. The bottled water was a refreshing complement to the rich flavors. Each dish was prepared with care, making for an exceptional dining experience. The Mac Shack has certainly raised the bar for mac and cheese eateries. Highly recommended!

"Better Off Bread in Sydney exceeds expectations with their delicious sandwiches. The Italian and Pastrami were both exceptional choices, packed with fresh ingredients and bursting with flavor. The bread was perfectly toasted, adding a satisfying crunch to every bite. The service was quick and friendly, making for a fantastic lunch experience. This food truck is a must-visit for sandwich lovers. Two thumbs up for Better Off Bread!"

A unique Ethiopian culinary experience in Sydney, The Veggie Combo from Tasty Tibs offered a vibrant array of flavors, with each vegetable component contributing its distinct taste. Soft and slightly sour, the injera bread provided a nice contrast to the spicy elements. However, the portion size was smaller than expected. Prompt service and friendly staff made for a pleasant dining experience overall. Considering the quality of ingredients used, the price point was reasonable. In the end, Tasty Tibs delivered an authentic Ethiopian meal that was satisfying, yet left us wanting just a bit more in terms of quantity.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney was an absolute delight! The rich, creamy pork broth was perfectly balanced, and the noodles were cooked to al dente perfection. The tender chashu pork melted in my mouth, and the ajitama egg was a delicious addition. The attentive service and cozy atmosphere made the experience even better. I highly recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar for anyone craving authentic, flavorful ramen.

Disappointed with my visit to Freezing Point in Sydney. The Two Scoop Bowl I ordered was a letdown. The ice cream lacked the creaminess I expected, and the flavors were not as vibrant as advertised. The overall experience did not meet my expectations for a quality ice cream shop. I had hoped for a delightful treat, but unfortunately, I left feeling underwhelmed.

The "Cheeky Greek" truck's gyro plate was a disappointment. The meat was dry and overcooked, and the pita bread was stale. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The service was unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The "Better Off Bread" food truck in Seoul served up a satisfactory dining experience. Italian sandwich: well-prepared with fresh ingredients, delivering a balanced flavor profile. Italian sandwich disappointments were absent. Pastrami: fell short of expectations, lacking the anticipated richness and depth. Refreshing Ice Tea was served. Bottled Water: standard issue. Service: prompt and efficient. Decent choice for a quick meal, but menu items require enhancement.

A hidden gem in Seoul, the Tasty Tibs truck dishes out scrumptious Ethiopian fare. The Veggie Combo presented an enticing blend of flavors and textures. The Lean Beef Tibs offered tenderness and succulence. Perfection in every bite, the dishes were impeccably spiced and cooked. Generous portions accompanied the meal, and the service was cordial and swift. This food truck is an essential destination for Ethiopian food enthusiasts in Seoul. The experience is guaranteed to exceed expectations.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Toronto. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, vibrant flavors one expects from Indian cuisine. The chicken was dry, and the masala sauce was bland, missing the usual spicy kick. The Combination Curry was equally underwhelming, with an unbalanced mix of vegetables and a sauce that was too watery. The overall experience was a far cry from the authentic Indian food I was hoping for.

This order was a disaster. The ice tea was lukewarm, the lo mein was overcooked and tasted burnt, the wonton soup was cold and flavorless, and the bottled water was warm. The service was terrible and the staff were unhelpful. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

A satisfying treat were the Kitchen Sink and Classic poutine from "Revenge of the Curds" in Madrid. The curds offered a crispy exterior and gooey interior, while the gravy was flavorful and rich. Golden and crispy were the fries, and the cheese was melted to perfection. The poutine meal was a delightful and hearty experience due to its deliciousness.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Barcelona serves a delightful treat with their New York Dog. This hot dog is skillfully put together, featuring fresh ingredients such as a glistening bun, succulent meat, crispy bacon, tart sauerkraut, and sweet relish. The toppings are both ample and well-balanced, resulting in a burst of flavors with every bite. The ambiance is relaxed and welcoming, making it an ideal place for a quick, satisfying meal. For any hot dog aficionado exploring Barcelona, the New York Dog at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" is an absolute must-try.

A culinary delight awaits at the Plant Palace truck, situated in Rio de Janeiro's core. Seitan Buffalo Wings, offered from the truck, were a treat to taste. Their tenderness and rich flavor were accentuated by a spicy kick that called for a sip of ice tea. The Salad of All Salads, brimming with fresh, crisp vegetables, served as a delightful accompaniment. The Veggie Burger impressed with its juicy texture and satisfaction. Each bite of the food was enjoyed with friendly service, enhancing the overall dining experience. Highly recommended for those craving a wholesome and flavorful meal on the go in Rio.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day with the Hot Ham & Cheese from Better Off Bread. The sandwich was served lukewarm, far from the 'hot' promised in its name. The ham was tough and lackluster, while the cheese was barely melted. The bread, a crucial element, was soggy and fell apart easily. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype around this Melbourne-based truck. I expected better from a place named 'Better Off Bread'. Unfortunately, this sandwich missed the mark.

Tasty Tibs truck in Melbourne proved to be an absolute delight. The lean beef tibs and veggie combo, both flavorful and satisfying, captivated my taste buds. The beef demonstrated a perfect balance of tenderness and spice, while the veggies boasted freshness and crispness. Accompanying the dish, the warm and fluffy injera bread paired wonderfully. Additionally, the friendly and attentive service elevated the overall experience. If you're on the hunt for a delicious, authentic Ethiopian meal to grab on the go, I highly suggest giving Tasty Tibs a try.

Disappointment was the main course on my visit to "Revenge of the Curds" in London. The Kitchen Sink, supposedly a hearty mix of all their offerings, was a chaotic mess of flavors that didn't blend well. The Classic, a staple in any poutine menu, lacked the essential crispiness that makes fries enjoyable, and the gravy was bland. Mother's Favorite, ironically, was the least favored, with a forgettable taste that didn't live up to its name. Unfortunately, this poutine experience was far from satisfying.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truly lives up to its name, serving hot dogs that are far from the worst! Their New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog are all bursting with flavor and authenticity. The bottled soda was a perfect companion, adding a refreshing twist to the meal. The experience was a delightful culinary journey across America's hot dog scene, right in the heart of New York City. A must-visit for all hot dog enthusiasts!"

A hidden gem in Toronto, Peking Truck serves up delectable Chinese cuisine. The Combo Lo Mein and Combo Fried Rice I ordered were impeccably cooked. The Lo Mein boasted a harmonious blend of flavors, while the Fried Rice was savory to the right degree. The Ice Tea provided a refreshing contrast to the meal. Generous portions and prompt, friendly service completed the satisfying experience. I wholeheartedly endorse a visit to Peking Truck for a delicious meal.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crêpes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a far cry from the expected savory delight. The filling was bland, lacking the rich, hearty flavors one anticipates in a pot pie. The crepe itself was soggy, failing to provide the necessary textural contrast. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert, was equally underwhelming. It was overly sweet, with the orange flavor barely detectable. The overall experience was a letdown, especially considering the reputation of this establishment. Mumbai's culinary scene has much more to offer than what was served here.

The King Combo, Greek Salad, and Bottled Soda from Cheeky Greek in Mumbai were an absolute delight. The King Combo, consisting of a succulent lamb gyros, fluffy pita bread, tangy tzatziki sauce, and fresh, crisp vegetables, was a treat for my taste buds. The Greek Salad, with its fresh, crunchy lettuce, juicy tomatoes, and creamy feta, perfectly complemented the gyros. The bottled soda selection offered a refreshing accompaniment to the meal. Overall, I couldn't fault the quality and freshness of the ingredients, the flavorful preparation, and the friendly service.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Paris served up a decent poutine experience. The Classic, a traditional combination of fries, cheese curds, and gravy, was satisfactory, with the fries maintaining a good crispiness despite being smothered in gravy. The cheese curds were sufficiently squeaky, a hallmark of freshness. Mother's Favorite, a more adventurous option with added ground beef and sautéed onions, was equally enjoyable, although it could have benefited from a bit more seasoning. The bottled water was standard. Overall, it was a solid meal, but it didn't particularly stand out among other poutine offerings.

Smoky BBQ in Paris's food offering was disappointing. Meat was served tough and dry, with the pulled pork sandwich being cold and unappetizing. The sides were overcooked and limp. On the positive side, the service was friendly and the restaurant was clean. Regrettably, the poor food quality and high prices make it difficult to recommend Smoky BBQ in Paris to potential diners.

The Peking Truck's combo fried rice and wonton soup was an utter disappointment. The rice was dry and flavorless, lacking the moisture and aromatic punch that one expects from a fried rice. The wonton soup, on the other hand, was overly salty and greasy, with cheap ingredients that tasted like they had been sitting in a fridge for far too long. The service was also unfriendly, with the staff being more concerned with their own conversations than with attending to customers. Overall, I would not recommend the Peking Truck to anyone seeking a genuine Chinese meal.

"Peking Truck in Sydney never fails to impress with their delicious Chinese cuisine! My recent order of Wonton Soup and Combo Fried Rice was absolutely scrumptious. The wontons were plump and flavorful, while the fried rice was chock-full of tasty ingredients. The service was quick and efficient, making it a great option for a satisfying lunch or dinner on-the-go. I highly recommend giving Peking Truck a try for all your Chinese food cravings in Sydney!" Greek salad disappointment. Lettuce limp, browned; tomatoes mushy, overripe; cucumbers watery, unremarkable. Only bright spot: feta cheese, creamy, tangy. Regrettably recommend against Greek salad from this eatery.

A straightforward experience was had at Cheeky Greek in Seoul with the Gyro Plate. The gyro meat exhibited a delightful flavor, harmoniously blended with an appropriate ratio of spices. Freshness shone through in the accompaniments. Portion size struck the right balance, neither excessive nor meager. However, the pita bread could have been moister to enhance enjoyment fully. Efficient service was provided, and the order arrived as anticipated. Satisfactory meal, yet opportunities for enhancement exist in certain areas.

The Mac Shack in Seoul offers a unique twist on traditional mac and cheese with their Lobster Mac & Cheese and Buffalo Mac & Cheese. The Lobster Mac & Cheese had a rich, creamy texture with generous chunks of lobster, while the Buffalo Mac & Cheese provided a spicy kick. However, the Buffalo flavor could have been more pronounced. The portions were satisfying, making it a filling meal. Overall, it's a decent spot for comfort food, but there's still room for improvement in terms of flavor balance.

The Mango Sticky Rice from the Freezing Point truck in Seoul was a delightful treat. The sticky rice was perfectly cooked, with a sweet and tangy mango flavor that was simply heavenly. The mango chunks were ripe and juicy, adding a delightful texture to the dish. The portion size was generous, and the price was reasonable. Overall, I highly recommend the Mango Sticky Rice from Freezing Point for anyone looking for a refreshing and flavorful treat.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Hamburg proves to be a true treasure for ramen aficionados. My order consisted of the Tonkotsu Ramen and the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and I can attest to their exquisite taste. The broth was richly flavored, and the noodles were cooked to perfection. The toppings were abundant and fresh, and the entire dining experience was nothing short of excellent. I wholeheartedly endorse this establishment for anyone craving genuine Japanese ramen.

Satisfying and underwhelming, the crepes from Le Coin des Crêpes in Hamburg offered a mix of emotions. Delightful, the Crepe Suzette boasted a perfect balance of sweetness and tanginess. Filling and savory, the Breakfast Crepe hit the spot. However, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe failed to meet expectations, lacking rich, comforting flavors. As expected, the bottled water was nothing out of the ordinary. In the end, an adequate dining experience with standout items and room for improvement.

Greek salad at "Cheeky Greek" in Denver was a letdown. The salad appeared limp and wilted, and its vegetables were past their prime. Saving grace was the dressing, full of flavor. However, the dressing's savory notes couldn't overcome the subpar quality of the ingredients. I advise against ordering the Greek salad from "Cheeky Greek" in Denver.

The food at Plant Palace was an absolute disaster. The salad was limp and wilted, the veggie burger was dry and flavorless, and the seitan buffalo wings were overcooked and rubbery. The service was also terrible, with long wait times and a rude staff. I would not recommend Plant Palace to anyone.

Unsatisfying encounter with "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in New York City. The Coney Dog fell short of desirable taste with its lackluster snap and unimpressive flavor. The bun's texture was disappointingly soggy, while the toppings failed to leave a memorable impression. The bottled soda was served lukewarm, adding to the lackluster experience. Overall, the visit was underpar and did not meet the anticipation set by New York City's renowned street food scene.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad were all satisfyingly flavorful. The gyro meat was tender and succulent, while the pita bread was warm and crispy. The Greek salad was refreshing and crisp, with a perfect balance of cucumbers, tomatoes, and onions. The bottled water and ice tea were refreshing and quenching. Overall, the food was delicious and the service was prompt.
